senses.synonym: 02064997-v (draw back, as with fear or pain; \""she flinched when they showed the slaughtering of the calf\"");02067699-v (show submission or fear

relations.target: recoil=07364792-n (a movement back from an impact);07365354-n (the backward jerk of a gun when it is fired);01374119-v (spring back, as from a forceful thrust; \""The gun kicked back into my shoulder\"");01896097-v (spring back; spring away from an impact; \""The rubber ball bounced\""; \""These particles do not resile but they unite after they collide\"");02064997-v (draw back, as with fear or pain; \""she flinched when they showed the slaughtering of the calf\"");02384041-v (come back to the originator of an action with an undesired effect; \""Your comments may backfire and cause you a lot of trouble\""; \""the political movie backlashed on the Democrats\""

shrink=00152378-v (decrease in size, range, or extent; \""His earnings shrank\""; \""My courage shrivelled when I saw the task before me\"");00241457-v (become smaller or draw together; \""The fabric shrank\""; \""The balloon shrank\"");00241924-v (reduce in size; reduce physically; \""Hot water will shrink the sweater\""; \""Can you shrink this image?\"");00242575-v (wither, as with a loss of moisture; \""The fruit dried and shriveled\"");02064997-v (draw back, as with fear or pain; \""she flinched when they showed the slaughtering of the calf\"");10507601-n (a physician who specializes in psychiatry

gesture=00335335-n (motion of hands or body to emphasize or help to express a thought or feeling);01230869-n (something done as an indication of intention; \""a political gesture\""; \""a gesture of defiance\"");06889359-n (the use of movements (especially of the hands) to communicate familiar or prearranged signals);00994073-v (show, express or direct through movement; \""He gestured his desire to leave\""

posture=02147248-v (assume a posture as for artistic purposes; \""We don't know the woman who posed for Leonardo so often\"");02524849-v (behave affectedly or unnaturally in order to impress others; \""Don't pay any attention to him--he is always posing to impress his peers!\""; \""She postured and made a total fool of herself\"");05009987-n (characteristic way of bearing one's body; \""stood with good posture\"");05087073-n (the arrangement of the body and its limbs; \""he assumed an attitude of surrender\"");05210917-n (capability in terms of personnel and materiel that affect the capacity to fight a war; \""we faced an army of great strength\""; \""politicians have neglected our military posture\"");06206019-n (a rationalized mental attitude

senses.definition: A posture or gesture of shrinking or recoiling.
